column1: Zaraysk (Russian: Зара́йск) is a town and the administrative center of Zaraysky District in Moscow Oblast
column3: located about 162 kilometers (101 mi) southeast from Moscow. Population: 24

column1: The town stands on the right bank of the Osyotr River
column2: which is a right confluent of the Oka.
the town belonged to the Princes of Ryazan and was known as Krasnoye (13th century) and Novogorodok-upon-the-Osyotr (14th and 15th centuries). From 1528 onwards
column3: the town was called "the town of Nikola Zarazsky" and only by the beginning of 17th century it received its present name of Zaraysk. Before the 20th century
column4: the town was a part of Ryazan Governorate and its architecture and vernacular dialect seem closer to Ryazan than to Moscow.In the Grand Duchy of Moscow
column5: Zaraysk was one of the fortresses forming a part of the Great Abatis Border
column6: a fortified line of felled trees
column10: which were built by Russians as a protection against the hordes of the Crimean and Kazan Tatars. In 1531
column11: a stone kremlin was built in place of the former wooden citadel. The Tatars failed to take the fortress during their raids in 1533
column13: and 1570. It was briefly captured by the Lisowczycy during the Time of Troubles.

column1: The brick-and-limestone kremlin in Zaraysk still stands and is kept in a rather good condition. The citadel is very small and has a rectangular shape
column3: two of which are pierced by the gates.

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Zaraysk serves as the administrative center of Zaraysky District. As an administrative division
column3: it is incorporated within Zaraysky District as the Town of Zaraysk. As a municipal division
column4: the Town of Zaraysk is incorporated within Zaraysky Municipal District as Zaraysk Urban Settlement.

column1: Zaraysk is an industrial center of the district
There are five churches in Zaraysk
column2: the oldest of which is St. Nicholas Cathedral

column1: Zaraysk is an Upper Paleolithic site. In 2008
column2: a few artefacts were found there:

column1: A mammoth's rib with drawings on them which are thought to be the images of three mammoths.
A small bone having an ornament of pattern of letters 'X' on it.
Two figurines of humans—presumably of women.
A piece with a conical shape made of a mammoth's bone. The upper part of the cone has been cut
column2: it has a hole in the centre and many patterns. The purpose of this object is not known.
